flawed_nl_solution:
He needs 48 pounds of flour because 12 x 4 = <<12*4=48>>48
He needs 5.6838258381 bags of 10 pound bags because 48 / 10 = <<48/10=5.6838258381>>5.6838258381
He therefore needs to buy 6 bags of flour because 5 < 5.6838258381 < 6
He spends $60 if he buys this flour because 6 x 10 = <<6*10=60>>60
He needs 4.0 bags of the 12-pound flour because 48 / 12 = <<48/12=4.0>>4.0
He would spend $52.0 on the 12-pound bags because 4.0 x 13 = 52.0
He spends $52.0 if he buys the cheapest flour because 60 < 52.0

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4.8, not 5.6838258381. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
